file_content.text: Get back to your ship, Cipher. We'll finish up here.
Diagnostics show fatal errors in the jamming systems, hyperdrive and shields. The ship is crippled, Cipher.
We've got a full fleet of reinforcements coming--including three Dark Council vessels. Jadus can't win against them.
But until they arrive, you need to keep him occupied on the bridge.
How am I supposed to do that?
"Occupied"?
Got it.
Not to sound cowardly, but I don't think that's wise.
What? Why?
We can't give Jadus the chance to prepare for a fight. He might lock the Eradicators' controls.
You can't beat Jadus in personal combat, but you might be able to trap him. This ship can generate internal ray shielding.
You can reroute the bridge defenses to trap him in a force field. Hopefully, it'll hold until the fleet jumps out of lightspeed.
Hopefully, a force field can hold him until the fleet jumps out of lightspeed.
Use the bridge controls to trap him in a force field. Hopefully, it'll hold until the fleet jumps out of lightspeed.
Let's hope for the best.
All right.
You can do this, Cipher. It's what you're good at.
What makes you think he won't kill me first?
The odds are against me.
You're one of the best, Cipher--time to prove it.
You don't sound very confident.
"Hopefully"?
There are no assurances. Not against a Sith Lord like Jadus.
I don't need to remind you that people are hurting because of us. But if we succeed... the sacrifice will be worthwhile. Watcher Two out.
I was afraid you wouldn't make it, Cipher. Good to see you alive.
The self-destruct sequence is complete--Jadus's ship has been reduced to cinders in Artus Five's gravity well.
And the Eradicator command codes went with it.
It's really finished.
Then it's over.
No more secret weapons, no more terrorists or traitors.
Any way to know what he'll do next?
Where's Jadus going?
No. I didn't even get a course projection when his shuttle jumped to hyperspace.
I believe that qualifies as a heroic victory.
Thanks to me.
I think it does, at that.
I'm sending a message to Keeper. These events will cause... complications among the Sith.
But I expect the Dark Council will sort matters quietly. They'll keep Jadus on the run. And we stopped a massacre.
I know you had doubts about the plan...
No regrets?
Will the Sith be angry we let Jadus escape?
How will the council react?
We might be called to account for ourselves--or it could be Keeper's burden.
You were ready to let that massacre happen.
I stopped it, not you.
I ran the numbers. I dread the day Jadus returns, and what he'll do.
But the call was yours--and I'm glad no one had to die.
The Song of the Universe favors our actions. The nest--our Empire--is stronger for it.
I'll take that as a compliment.
Well, thanks.
That is how it was intended.
I'm glad you were here to help.
You did good, Vector.
So are we. We've often been uncertain about our place in Intelligence--but not right now.
The bugboy has a point.
I don't need your approval, Vector.
Keep it to yourself.
We won't argue the point.
You didn't do bad. I'd have gutted the Sith, though.
If we run into Jadus again, I'll see what I can do.
Maybe next time.
I'll hold you to it.
Come on--don't tell me you didn't get a rush.
You still had fun, though.
Sure--running from a Dark Lord on an exploding ship. It's the reason I stick with you.
You really don't care about the people we saved, do you?
We did it to stop a massacre!
Come on. We all die eventually.
I'll see you at headquarters, Cipher. Enjoy the downtime while it lasts--there'll be debriefings, cleanup, and sooner than you think, Keeper will have your next assignment.
On my way to Dromund Kaas now.
Understood.
See you back at home, Watcher Two.
We'll talk later.
You're assuming Keeper can find me.
I might not be available.
We're Imperial Intelligence. We can find anyone.
Mission accomplished. Watcher Two out.
Ship's power levels becoming unstable. You did it, Cipher--this whole place is about to explode.
Give me a status update. The Sith....
Where's Darth Jadus?
Out of the force field and on his way to a shuttle. I can't abort the launch--he's got a clean escape.
Give me an update. The terror attack....
Eradicator status?
Never began. The deactivation worked, and once this ship is destroyed, the Eradicators cease to be a threat.
What's the fastest way out of here?
Time to run.
Your ship's still safe. I calculate it's your best chance.
As for Jadus--he's out of the force field and on his way to a shuttle. No way to catch him... but he won't recover from this setback anytime soon.
Forget Jadus. We'll deal with him another day.
Let him go.
Acknowledged.
If there's more, now's the time to tell me.
Anything else?
Too bad we can't make him pay.
Damn him.
You decided that stopping the Eradicators was more important. You knew what you were doing.
I'm taking off, but I'll wait in-system as long as I can. You need to get out before the reactor detonates. Good luck.
All right--you've got him trapped, but it won't last. Now get to the reactor core and initiate the self-destruct! Sending coordinates now.
We can talk later, Cipher. Head on back.
Forgive us, master. We failed your vision.
Jadus would've made everyone into slaves like them. It's a nightmarish thought.
Some may reintegrate into society, given the chance. Others....
I want them taken care of. No experiments, no indefinite confinement....
Make sure they get help.
Of course. I'll make sure your request is heard.
You should've seen what Jadus did to his daughter.
They're mad as Zhorrid.
I can't imagine... I don't want to.
Still, we should be celebrating. It's a good day.
They're lucky to be alive.
Nasty creatures.
They're alive because of you. You can be proud of that.
Going down the list: The Empire saved, Darth Jadus on the run, an Imperial dreadnaught recovered and the survivors rescued... I'd call this mission a success.
He's still out there, you know.
What about Jadus?
He's lost his followers, his resources and his base of operations. He won't return for a while.
In other words, we did fantastic.
Agreed.
We did, at that.
We'll be rounding up the Eagle's cells for a while, yet.
And the terrorists?
True... but without a strong leader, they won't be hard to deal with.
The bridge is yours, Cipher. What do you say we set course for home?
Back to Dromund Kaas, then.
Very well.
Would you do the honors, Watcher Two?
Please, go ahead.
Certainly.
This is Watcher Two to Keeper. Jumping to lightspeed now--prepare for our arrival....
I don't suppose I can keep this ship?
The bridge is mine, eh?
If you wanted a dreadnaught, you joined the wrong service.
Still, if you insist--take it up with Keeper....
Cipher--be careful!
Find the Eradicator command codes, Cipher. And if he's real... find the traitor.
This place is stark. We smell no pheromones, feel no auras... we should be cautious.
Nice place. The Eagle's partner travels in style.
Cipher. There's no one to welcome us... seems our cloaking devices worked.
Where are we, anyway?
What is all this?
In orbit around Artus Five. It's a gas giant--no life-forms.
Good to see you, too. How was the flight?
Hello, Watcher Two.
Uneventful, fortunately. I stayed in your wake.
Don't get overconfident. This could be a trap.
I don't like it.
I'm aware of that possibility.
This starship is a modified Imperial dreadnaught. Maximum crew complement of five thousand.
It's also jamming long-range communications, so I can't check its registration--or call for reinforcements.
Our traitor is hiding his tracks.
More Imperial connections.
Can we neutralize the jamming field?
Jamming?
Maybe. I'll see if I can locate the signal generator.
You're off to a fine start.
That's not helpful.
I could do without the sarcasm.
Nonetheless, top priority is finding the Eradicator command codes before the weapons initiate a random firing pattern.
This data spike contains our half of the codes. Once you obtain the other half, you should be able to control the Eradicators from any computer.
Any idea where the codes might be stored?
How do I proceed?
If we're lucky, they'll be on the bridge computers--and you can deactivate the Eradicators from there. If they're not... I don't know.
All I want to do is shut those things down.
I don't need "control."
Fair enough, but they can't be deactivated, targeted or anything else without both halves of the command codes.
Let's hope the codes are really here.
Assuming this isn't a mistake.
We know this place is important--an Imperial dreadnaught isn't hiding in deep space for nothing.
I do have one other thing for you--a comlink implant. So long as you're wearing it, I can monitor your situation and speak to you privately.
Is this one-way communication, or can I reply?
Can I respond?
Subvocally. Whisper to me and no one else will hear.
I assumed you were coming with me.
You're staying here?
Keep chatter to a minimum, understand?
Don't distract me.
I'll maintain silence unless there's an emergency.
While you search the interior, I'll try to slice the security systems.
I don't believe my trust in you is misplaced. Put an end to this.
We're counting on you. Put an end to this.
We need to find those control codes. Time we flew to Artus.
Cipher. I'm glad you stopped by.
I've been going over the mission parameters. Studying the Eradicator control codes, scans of the Artus system....
We're facing a mystery--and I hate mysteries.
You should get some rest before we leave.
Don't exhaust yourself.
I don't remember how. Times like this, I wonder if it took much more to push Watcher X over the edge.
You may hate mysteries, but you're pretty good at solving them.
You'll figure it out.
I am. I don't mind having that recognized--call it vanity, but I like knowing my creation served a purpose.
What about you? What's been going through your head since this countdown to "Eradication Day" started?
It's hard not to wonder where it all ends, sometimes.
This work is relentless.
It doesn't. Not until your death.
The crisis may change, but the job doesn't.
You really think that's true?
I might disagree.
Keeper took me aside early on to tell me there's no glory in our work. He's right.
That's why it's important we stick together.
At least we face it as a team.
Maybe I'm in the wrong business.
Makes me wonder why I'm here.
Maybe. But without you, the Eagle might still be out there.
All I can think is that someone's betraying us.
The traitor worries me.
Don't. Keeper knows the players involved, and Lodenth and I can run the psychological profiles. If someone's disloyal, we'll find out.
You sound awfully sure of that.
You think so?
I am. And I don't want to discuss the matter further.
At least there are some people we can trust.
We can count on each other.
It's worth remembering.
You've been a good partner, you know. A struggle sometimes, but you know what you're doing. I admire that.
I didn't think you admired anyone.
I'm surprised.
Just people who don't share my weaknesses.
That's nice to hear you say.
Thank you.
What do you mean, "a struggle"?
"A struggle"?
Don't deny it. Still, you don't see me filing complaints.
Aren't you suspicious of the people here?
What if it's one of us?
This isn't the time or place, Cipher. I won't discuss the matter further.
Honestly... I've been thinking about you.
[Flirt] You want the truth?
I've been thinking of you, as well... at least when my brain has cycles to spare.
You're as good a partner as I could hope for--as I've ever had. We've made quite a team.
I think so, too.
Agreed.
I think we've been more than teammates.
[Flirt] Is that all?
We have. I can't say it wasn't memorable.
Ever wish we could be more than a team?
[Flirt] Is that all?
I... appreciate the interest, Cipher. But I don't think it's appropriate.
I'm aware of your "relationship" with the alien. I don't plan to interfere with that.
I'm sorry--I wasn't thinking.
I apologize.
It's not Kaliyo I'm interested in. It's you.
But I care about you.
It doesn't matter. Just... drop it. All right?
Come on--what's it going to hurt?
It'll be fun!
Drop the subject, Cipher. Please.
You just can't trade up, can you, agent?
Imperial Intelligence does encourage bonding.
Look, I've done what I can here. Before we leave... would you like to go somewhere private? Get reacquainted?
What about your place? Somewhere not in the Citadel and not in a starship.
I'd like that.
Sounds like time well-spent.
Why not?
We don't have long... so, let's make the most of what time we have.
That was lovely, Cipher--now, you should get ready. We have a mission to stop the Eradicators.
I'll see you when we reach the Artus system.
Time to work.
I'll be right behind you--watching your back.
We'll have to celebrate afterward.
Another time, then?
Maybe so--assuming we have an Empire left to celebrate.
The job always gets in the way.
All business, no fun....
Mm, but the job needs doing.
I don't think it would be professional. Or wise.
We probably shouldn't.
Of course. As you say, Cipher.
Watcher Two and Cipher Nine, saving the Empire.
We are pretty great.
Let's hope, shall we?
I thought only the terrorists called it "Eradication Day."
"Eradication Day"?
The name caught on around headquarters. Adopting the language of the enemy can be useful.
I don't need to hear your complaints.
That's not my problem.
Apologies. I spoke out of turn.
In any case, you should get ready. The Eradicators won't wait for either of us.
No time for chat, then.
Always so busy....
Even less than usual.
Understood.
We don't have much of a choice, do we?
You don't need to explain the obvious.
I get it already.
Of course, Cipher.
Once you take off for the Artus system, I'll be on your tail. We'll meet out there.
Signal received. Transmission secure.
All right, Cipher. Looks like this is the real thing. Ready to invade the Eagle's nest?
You'd better believe it.
Oh, yes.
Right now, I'm going in blind. You tell me.
Hard to say without data.
Givin-Paigun probability calculus suggests eighty-six percent odds. I ran the numbers myself.
I didn't come to drink tea with my Hutt friends.
That's my job, isn't it?
I'll cancel the invitation to Nem'ro.
The Eagle and his men are holed up in an old refinery beneath the river. Sending coordinates now.
You'll lead the forward assault, but military reinforcements will surround the base and follow you in. Primary objective is to capture or eliminate the Eagle himself.
Why send me in first?
I'm not a soldier.
You can be subtle--and besides, this is our operation. We're not handing it over to military brutes.
Got it.
I don't need soldiers slowing me down.
Keep them out of my way.
Agreed. They'll wait on your insertion before proceeding.
Your secondary objective is the Eradicators. The terrorists have begun launching their biomechanical weapons over Imperial worlds.
Once the devices are ready, the terrorists can fire on cities and military bases from orbit.
We'll find a way to stop them.
That won't happen.
I hope so. After the Dominator--everyone who died along with Darth Jadus--I don't want to go through that again.
Why haven't the devices been activated already?
But they aren't firing yet?
It could be the Eradicators aren't fully mature. It could be their activation is more complicated than expected.
It never should have come to this.
What a mess.
We were too busy defending against Republic superweapons to look for threats from within.
When you're in that base, don't let anyone escape. Don't let the Eagle murder again.
And please... come back alive. Watcher Two out.
Watcher Two out.
This is Watcher Two to Cipher Nine. Verify that you're receiving and prepare for takeoff. We've located the Eagle.
Tell me where.
Let's hear it.
Watcher Two, you're fantastic!
That's great!
I certainly am. And you're going to love this.
It's about time. We've been waiting for this.
I'll deal with him.
We knew the Eagle had abandoned his old base, but until you neutralized that last cell, we didn't know the details.
Now we do. The Eagle is on Hutta. Get there as soon as you can.
It all comes back to the beginning.
Hutta again...
For you, at least.
Do you have an exact location?
Details, please.
Working on it--I've got half a dozen satellites scanning the swamps.
He must be getting pretty desperate.
That's a sorry place.
I've no doubt he is.
I have to go now, Cipher, but I'll brief you on-site. Watcher Two out.
Secure transmission established. This is Watcher Two.
Your efforts to destabilize the terror network are working better than expected, Cipher. Unfortunately, I don't have good news.
We attempted to capture the Eagle in a raid on Tholatin. We found a base, but the man had moved on.
Is there a trail we can follow?
That's something, at least.
No. I'm still hopeful your efforts will draw him into the open.
You're going to make me start dreading these calls.
Never good news, huh?
We can't have that. You're one of my few bright spots.
I don't like reporting bad news any more than you like hearing it.
If we can't find him, we'll keep attacking his network.
He's nothing without allies.
Agreed. Sooner or later, he'll have nowhere to run.
We've also been researching the so-called "Eradicator" devices. They're satellites--orbital strike weapons with enough firepower to level a city.
Here's the bizarre thing: The terrorists aren't building the Eradicators. They're growing them.
What do you mean "growing"?
Growing?
I'm not sure I understand.
Never figured the Eagle for a gardener.
So we're fighting trees, now.
For the record, he's not, according to our profile.
The Eradicators are a combination of biological and mechanical components--organic batteries in a weaponized shell.
The terrorists don't need factories anymore; they can grow Eradicators wherever there's room.
Cheap, destructive and disposable.
Clever.
Our people are jealous they didn't think it up.
How do we handle all this?
What's the plan?
We'll continue gathering information. We know what the Eradicators are, but not where or how they'll be used.
Do we know when the terrorists plan to attack?
How long do we have?
Not tomorrow, but soon. For now, we'll continue gathering information.
You have your own targets. But be careful out there--we don't want to lose you.
I appreciate the concern. I'll be okay.
Of course.
Don't tell me you're getting soft, Watcher Two.
Worried about me?
Don't tell me you think that's possible, Cipher Nine.
Glad to know you still feel something for me.
I knew you cared!
We're partners on a job. Don't overestimate what that means.
I'll be in contact when I have more information. Watcher Two out.
You have your own mission. Destroy the cells, and they'll lead us to the Eagle. Watcher Two out.
Transmitting security codes. This is Watcher Two to Cipher Nine.
I'm glad you're back on duty. After you dismantled the cells on Balmorra and Nar Shaddaa, the rest of the terror network went into overdrive.
The more they move, the more visible they get. Our advantage.
Good for us.
I'm not complaining.
How are they responding, exactly?
What do you mean?
Increased chatter, transfer of goods, activation of safe houses. Fascinating, really.
If you need me to slow down, I wouldn't mind a vacation.
Having trouble keeping up?
No need for that yet, but I'll pass it on to Keeper.
I told you before about the Eagle's mystery weapon--the "Eradicator" devices. We still don't know what they are, but we intercepted this transmission.
--once the devices are fully functional, I'll enter the targeting codes myself. Only then will instructions be sent.
But all cells are encouraged to prepare attacks on secondary targets.
Once the Eradicators cause chaos in every Imperial stronghold, you must fan the flames. Stand tall above the wreckage.
Shape the destruction into a message. That is how we prevail.
That was the Eagle himself. It seems the assassination of Darth Jadus was only the start.
We've eliminated two of his terror cells. We can stop this.
We'll be ready.
I've run the odds. I wish I were as certain as you.
Certainly intimidating, but what does that actually tell us?
There's so little information.
Barely enough to add to his profile.
Listen to his voice. He has no idea what we can do to him.
He's overconfident.
You may be right, but that's no guarantee of success.
There is good news. We have leads on two new terror cells, vital to the network's operation. They're your next targets.
Proceed to Tatooine and Alderaan at your discretion; your mission will continue there. Watcher Two out.
Secure transmission established. This is Watcher Two.
I'm glad you checked in, Cipher. Chatter has increased among the surviving cells, and it seems the Eagle is planning another attack.
What kind of attack?
An attack?
We're not sure.
I just eliminated a group of terrorists, and you can't say "congratulations"?
Not even a "thank you"?
Sorry. Congratulations indeed. Now, we have a serious problem.
We can handle anything he throws at us.
The Eagle's not a problem.
I hope you're right.
The Eagle only needed one cell to bomb the Dominator and assassinate Darth Jadus. For what's coming, he's using the entire terror network.
But the messages we've intercepted are frustratingly vague. Just cryptic references to devices called "Eradicators."
Any idea what an "Eradicator" is?
Go on.
A weapon of some sort. But is it a laser? A virus? I don't know.
If anyone can get to the truth of it, you can.
You'll figure it out.
I'm plugging myself into the monitors while I sleep, hoping my subconscious will sort it out. No luck so far.
Bad news.
Isn't it, though?
Not much to be done at the moment. You need to focus on taking the terror network apart.
As you eliminate the larger cells, we can identify more terrorist activity centers. Eliminate enough, and the network will lose cohesion.
Then I'll proceed to the next cell.
Acknowledged.
We'll get together once this is over, have a drink.
[Flirt] See you soon.
We should. I haven't had a chance to relax since you left Dromund Kaas--I could use an excuse to leave the Citadel.
We had good times together.
I remember those days.
We did. Maybe we will again, sooner or later.
Don't let this job wear you out, Watcher Two.
Take care of yourself.
I appreciate the sentiment--but the Empire made me for this job. Even if it destroys me, I've served a purpose.
Life isn't the same without your favorite operative, hm?
Of course you miss me.
That's exactly it, Cipher Nine.
We'll have the opportunity.
I appreciate the update. Anything else?
Thanks.
I'll do everything I can from here. It's been four days since I stepped outside the Citadel... but I'm in no hurry.
Guess I'll be bailing you out again.
Where would you be without me?
Good. Why don't you shoot a few people? That always helps me sort the data.
Sorry. That was uncalled for. I just haven't had the energy to spend on... social protocol.
I'll be in touch. Watcher Two out.
This is Cipher Nine to headquarters. Do you have my target list?
Watcher Two here. I've finished preliminary mapping of the Eagle's network.
Your designated targets are terror cells located on Balmorra, near the Republic border; and on Nar Shaddaa, in Hutt space.
I'll contact you once I've arrived. Cipher Nine out.
I'll proceed there now.
Acknowledged. Watcher Two out.
I just had a very interesting meeting with Darth Jadus's daughter. Any information on her?
Do you know Darth Zhorrid?
I'm afraid that data isn't mission-relevant.
I was expecting a few more than that.
Just two? Not much challenge.
We have other operatives handling the low-priority cells, but I expect your list to grow instead of shrink as we learn more.
Contact me once you've arrived at either location, Cipher. Watcher Two out.
Now's not the time.
Cipher Nine will tell you what we need.
Balmorra and Nar Shaddaa were a good start, but we have a long way to go. Watcher Two out.
You're keeping us busy. The terror network goes into overdrive when a cell loses contact.
Lord Zhorrid has made it clear that we're not to contact you now. I'm sorry.
You need to get off this ship right now, Cipher!
This is Cipher Nine to Watcher Two. Please respond.
Contact authorization denied.
This is Imperial Automated Defense Corps unit CR-97. By order of Darth Zhorrid, Lord of the Dark Council, your ship is now in lockdown.
Cipher Nine. The last time we spoke, I called you to Korriban. Did you misunderstand what a privilege that audience was?
You asked me to seek out the people who assassinated Lord Jadus, and that's what I've been doing.
What's going on, Zhorrid?
Now why are you locking down my ship?
It was a great honor. I only hope to live up to your expectations.
I understood, my lord.
You've failed so far; I haven't heard a word from you about Darth Jadus's assassination. But you deserve another chance.
If I recall, you tried to have me murdered as some sort of test.
You had your guards attack me.
Many would beg for the opportunity to serve one of the Dark Council.
You've not impressed me, Cipher. You've given me no new information since your mission began, about the murder of Darth Jadus or otherwise.
When you receive my orders, you'll do as you're told... or I'll have you flayed alive, along with everyone you know. Understood?
I understand, and beg forgiveness.
Yes, my lord.
It will have to do.
I assure you, my lord, I've reported all my findings to Intelligence.
I've been doing my duty.
Very well--perhaps it's not you I should blame.
My orders come from Keeper, not the Sith.
I don't answer to you.
Perhaps I should kill you for your impudence. But you are useful... so perhaps I'll kill Keeper.
Now. My peers on the Dark Council acknowledge me--but they don't yet respect me. Not like they did my father.
To secure my position, I must have my father's secrets--the mysteries Darth Jadus never deigned to teach me.
My task will be to find these "secrets"?
You want me to help you.
Your task is to find one whom Jadus trusted.
You think Jadus's secrets will win the council members' respect?
That'll be enough power?
Once I possess the tools my father used, the Dark Council will have no choice but to admire me.
I think you're in over your head.
You're getting desperate.
How dare you? You're not Sith. You're certainly not my father.
I was his only apprentice, but he favored Force-blind advisors over his own daughter.
Of course, most of his advisors died with him on the Dominator... but not all. Vyord Yanol stayed behind. Vyord Yanol fled to Nar Shaddaa.
Was he afraid of something? And why Nar Shaddaa?
Why did he flee?
I expect that when Jadus died, Yanol knew no one could keep him safe anymore.
And this advisor can tell you what Jadus knew.
You want him for yourself.
I know he can. Why else would he flee, unless he feared sharing?
Then again, maybe Yanol conspired with Jadus's rivals. Maybe he was involved in my father's death. The end result is the same.
Do you think Yanol knows something about the terrorists?
Could Intelligence use him?
It's conceivable, I suppose. He might have shared their ideals, or conspired with Jadus's rivals. The end result is the same.
My sources have found his hideout. You will catch him and bring him to me. Until then, we are finished.
